name: Patchwork
description: At Patchwork we are transforming the way healthcare workers engage with their employers, cutting out the middlemen and saving the NHS millions of pounds every year from agency fees.

team.name: Jing Ouyang
team.bioHtml: COO and Cofounder at @Patchwork

team.name: Philip Lidstone
team.bioHtml: Co-Founded Ryalto, Advisor to several London startups at various stages of funding from seed to series A.

team.title: Head of Marketing
team.name: Celine Prinse
team.bioHtml: Head of Marketing leading all marketing strategies to increase awareness & sales. Proudly worked with Richard Branson & Malala Yousafzai.

jobs.title: Data Scientist
jobs.description:
Patchwork is growing. Grow with us!

Backed by Praetura Ventures, Harvard Business Angels and the BMJ. Founded by former NHS Doctors. Patchwork is being brought to life by a talented and diverse team. 

**Background**
Patchwork connects clinicians with shifts—saving the NHS millions, keeping medics happy & making sure a doctor is there when you need one most. Our products have been shown to reduce admin burden and save costs for NHS Trusts across the country. With the ongoing pandemic we have seen an enormous increase in activity and our solution is playing an important role in the COVID-19 response. 

Do your best work.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing Product and Customer Succes team where your work will be instrumental in moving Patchwork’s mission forward.

**Responsibilities:**
* Analyse data and report results to help inform decision making
* Use data insights to design and build Machine Learning algorithms
* Design and perform experiments to test the effectiveness of products we build and actions we take

**Requirements**

At Patchwork we want to hire people with the experiences necessary to get going quickly, but who are also interested in learning new things and are comfortable working in a changing environment.

Here are some of the things we think will be valuable, but we're also open-minded. If you recognise yourself any of these traits then we’d love for you to send us an application:

* Masters/PhD or equivalent experience in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Sciences or Operational Research
* 2+ years experience applying Machine Learning to real-world problems
* Comfortable coding in Python and SQL
* Experienced with cloud infrastructure (GCP, AWS, Azure)
* Comfortable with challenging prescribed thinking
* Exceptional communication skills, able to communicate complex ideas in a simple fashion
* Based in an EU Location
